website_summaries.verdict: EVANS may seem pricy, but considering its waterless formula won’t degrade over time or corrode your cooling system, and works as an antifreeze up to -40°F, this is easily the best long-term investment for your marine engine.
pros: Waterless coolant protects against corrosion and electrolysis
Lasts the life of your engine
cons: EVANS is a high-end, yet relatively expensive coolant

customer_reviews.title: Same as Evans NPG+ for Rotax Aircraft Engines.
customer_reviews.text: Same as Evans NPG+. Small print on original back label confirmed this. Small print on back of revised label simply says Approved for Rotax Aircraft Engines. So, don't let anyone sell you new old stock of NPG+ at ridiculously inflated prices for a Rotax 912. Your engine will run HOTTER with this coolant compared to conventional. The thermal efficiency is LESS than water. BUT, the boiling point of this coolant is much higher, so you will be protected from potentially damaging hot spots and vaporization of coolant inside your heads. Does what it is supposed to do.
customer_reviews.author: DiamondPilot

customer_reviews.title: It is called coolant but it doesn't cool nearly as well as water.
customer_reviews.text: I spent the big money on this product after seeing jay leno give the thumbs up. So after running this stuff in my 70 aar cuda for 6 months and chasing my tail trying to get it to run cool I finally found the problem. It was the Evans coolant. This stuff works but you will run hotter. In my case I dropped 30 degrees temp by switching back to the old green antifreeze and water 50/50. I was not comfortable running 210 and watching it climb higher at stops. So if you have an old muscle car I would recommend saving your money and use what it had in it back in the day.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Jay Leno was right.
customer_reviews.text: I put this product in my Boss Hoss motorcycle and it seems to run a little hotter. What with the cost of operating and maintaining a Boss Hoss, knowing I could get a few extra miles/years out of engine by using this product was a deal maker for me. I'm wondering if adding a bottle of Wetter Water might help to reduce the operating temperature. I was running just water and a coolant additive in the past.
customer_reviews.author: MUTT WONDERDUCK

customer_reviews.title: Been running Evans for years now in a 1996 Volvo ...
customer_reviews.text: Been running Evans for years now in a 1996 Volvo 850. Had a heater core leak that only dripped with this stuff, giving me plenty of time to order a replacement. When I took the heater core out I noticed the entire bottom of the heater core had actually split (common problem with this particular heater core). If I had been running anything else it would have been a catastrophic failure 500 miles from home.
customer_reviews.author: looncraz

customer_reviews.title: Great Stuff
customer_reviews.text: Installed in my classic car a year ago, no evaporation, and keeps engine cool in the desert were I live. I weighted the pros and cons of antifreeze vs Evans, and to date glad I converted. It’s pricey to Convert ( but I had a shop do it), which added to the cost, but if I performed it, And messed something up, then would have to take to a shop that installs the product anyway. But that’s just me.
customer_reviews.author: Martin A.

customer_reviews.title: As described
customer_reviews.text: I bought it to keep the pressure down in my 34 Coupe. It seems to be doing exactly what they described but I will say that my car runs about 15 degrees hotter then it did with anti freeze. If the boiling point is higher it should not be a problem but I still don't think it is good to have a motor in the 215 range.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Jay Leno uses this stuff...I put it in my DeLorean
customer_reviews.text: OK for those that say this is too expensive, you do know you can re-use this stuff right? Unlike other anti-freezes that may be 5 year, extended life, Evans IS for LIFE. Museums use it in their car collections. They talk about this on PowerNation's Engine Power show and Jay Leno's Garage. Not much else to say except I hope EVANS sticks around for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: cpear760

customer_reviews.title: Wow my car has never been so Cool!
customer_reviews.text: My car runs cooler than ever. This thicker fluid also does not leak out easily because it does not build pressure. With normal antifreeze my car would run 20 degrees hot when it sat on a hot day. All I did was change the fluid and its staying exactly on the Thermostat 185 and holding! Great product. had to drain the block to get all of the old water out but well worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Brent

customer_reviews.title: engine runs hot
customer_reviews.text: My 1969 ford engine temperature now averages about 200 to 230 plus degrees. Temperature rises quickly while car is stopped at idle and is slow to come down when you start moving. Its nice with no pressure in the system and no corrosion. However, prior with 50/50 antifreeze the temperature always stayed at 180. Not sure how my engine is going to do in the long run with big temperature fluctuations. Evans needs to start reassuring me, that this is ok, or I'm going back to 50/50.
customer_reviews.author: Steven C Hudson

customer_reviews.title: This is such a great development in anti freeze protection
customer_reviews.text: This is such a great development in anti freeze protection. It appears to be non corrosive and long lasting. The high boiling point is a plus as well. Initially it is a pricy product, but when lifetime use, no need to flush and drain cooling system in the future, it really is a bargain. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t understand
customer_reviews.text: Shipping was really fast! I don’t understand why I buy 1 gallon 4 different orders its 8 dollars cheaper than if I buy a case of 4? Makes no sense! It didn’t come with any stickers ( do not add water) I called Evans and they said they will have them in the mail today. I have only got as far as the flush and I only needed a half gallon because I have the radiator out and the t-stat so I first blew it out from the upper hose with leaf blower and then added a 1/2 gallon of flush and blew it out, heater core just needed blown out with air compressor thru heater hose.
customer_reviews.author: Peter dragon

customer_reviews.title: It seems to work fine
customer_reviews.text: I used this product on my 2006 E350. I probably would not use it on MB or BMW because they come with a very good coolant. The quality of MB coolant is very good.. When I drained and flushed the system I realized that it did not need it.. I would used it on a domestic car for sure.. This product seems to be very good and if it really last the life of the car, it's worth it. I read that it does not cool as traditional 50/50 mix. That is for sure.. Nothing cools like water. I had no temp issues on my MB and that is taking a 400 mile trip.
customer_reviews.author: Harry

customer_reviews.title: Peace of mind for your cooling system
customer_reviews.text: I got this extra gallon for the situation in which my conversion which included a new radiator and new hoses, would leak for some reason... It did not but it's great to have some extra coolant on hand because you can't mix it up with water. If your entire cooling system is in perfect shape you won't ever need to top off, but still it's nice to have some extra.
customer_reviews.author: A Dude

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with product
customer_reviews.text: Built a new project about 3 years ago and decided to try the stuff out. I wanted that extra protection I've not overheating and having good lubricating properties. I'm very pleased what's this product, it delivers everything it says and exceeded my expectation. A little expensive but for my engine build it was worth it
customer_reviews.author: qaz Customer

customer_reviews.title: Greatest coolant ever
customer_reviews.text: Greatest coolant ever! I've used evans waterless coolant on my vehicles for over 10yrs now. It's a life saver and an engine saver especially on cooling systems that are under higher pressure like the bmw e39 and e46. Im running it on my current 2003 bmw 530i and my 2014 Infiniti Q50
customer_reviews.author: Eddie Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, non toxic, non corrosive antifreeze for your car
customer_reviews.text: Non Toxic, Fantastic antifreeze to protect your engine and radiator. I suggest if you own a vehicle that uses antifreeze that you buy this product immediately. You will NEVER have to change your radiator ever again with this product. This product does not use any corrosive water in the cooling system like regular anti-freeze. So your heating system will operate with minimum pressure, maximum life for cooling line radiator hoses. Great job!
customer_reviews.author: It's Me

customer_reviews.title: So much less pressure!!
customer_reviews.text: So much less pressure on the coolant system. I put this in my E39 540I touring. E39 540I touring run around 230F, this results in 30 PSI on the coolant system. The high temp and PSI cause premature coolant system failures. Evans cool is the solution to that. At full temp coolant lines are nice and compressible, and the engine only runs a degree or two warmer. No question that this will save me headaches in the future
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best coolant hardest coolant to install for pro use only
customer_reviews.text: Best coolant made but a pain to install must flush old coolant completely with clean water then get dry then install. Can't mix with any other coolants makes jello and clogs system be sure you want the task for the price you pay for the best
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Highly recommend for car enthusiasts.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Evans for a couple of years now in my car. It does a wonderful job at keeping things cool. I saw a guy actually make more power using this product on back to back Dyno runs with nothing changed except the coolant.
customer_reviews.author: Cole

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: Impressive the difference in cooling this makes! I have a custom 515hp LS motor and wheel some very tough trails in Moab in very hot days and this runs super cool all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Clark K

customer_reviews.title: Waterless Coolant is great
customer_reviews.text: Evans makes a product that prevent pressure buildup in your water cooling system. Used straight it prevents hot spots and pressure buildup to prevent hose blow off. It will not signifcantly reduce coolant temperatures, but will save your engine if it goes above the warning level.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: should be standard in Jaguars
customer_reviews.text: Put it in all the Jaguars I have owned (3)and has helped with cooling and improves mileage maybe a mile per gallon. Don't need the flush if you can leave it on the rack to drain over night
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Protects my cooling system.
customer_reviews.text: A good investment for any clean cooling system. Keeps the engine from overheating.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Sherman

customer_reviews.title: but oes a Great Job keeping my Vets cooling system top notch
customer_reviews.text: Always keep some as backup,because it is hard to find around my area. Had a hose come loose,and leaked a Gallon. I had a backup,and it isn't cheep,but oes a Great Job keeping my Vets cooling system top notch!
customer_reviews.author: mikey

customer_reviews.title: I really hope it works the way it supposed to
customer_reviews.text: I love the idea I really hope it works the way it supposed to
customer_reviews.author: oldguy

customer_reviews.title: Great for your classic car
customer_reviews.text: Use this on all my classic cars. Not only does it work as advertised but during long winter layup no worries.
customer_reviews.author: jspan

customer_reviews.title: Good Product Best Vendor
customer_reviews.text: I Have used Evans in my classic for years. Due to some engine issues I had to replace the coolant. I always ordered from Hoer Racing because of best price and shipping. Now they are with Amazon Prime and price is still the best and shipping is super fast.
customer_reviews.author: Ansel Adams

customer_reviews.title: This product is amazing!
customer_reviews.text: This is the only coolant we will utilize in our racing engines. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Evans coolant
customer_reviews.text: I have used this coolant before, and truly it has saved my a** from engine damage due to overheating!
customer_reviews.author: Jim Hall

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Product!
customer_reviews.text: Only coolant to use when driving in harsh conditions, no boil over, low vapor pressure.
customer_reviews.author: James Leithauser

customer_reviews.title: A little pricey when compared to anti-freeze, but it works so well for my high performance engine.
customer_reviews.text: The end results are exactly why I spent the money to change over to a waterless system. It works well and doesn't allow for hot spots due to lack of water turing to steam in the extreme situations.
customer_reviews.author: David Wright

customer_reviews.title: This product is junk
customer_reviews.text: I flushed the radiator 5 times with water to clean it then used the prep as instructed then put the coolest in and on the first drive the car overheated to a danger point so I took the coolant back out and put antifreeze back in and it now runs cool again
customer_reviews.author: Philip G.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works Great, make sure you buy the Prep fluid too
customer_reviews.author: Sitha

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Installed in my 73 Vette and it really works as advertised. This car has always run hot. Installed a new radiator and Evans coolant. It now runs cool. I like that it does not build much pressure in the cooling system.
customer_reviews.author: M. B.

customer_reviews.title: I gave Evans a try after my son's KTM 50cc ...
customer_reviews.text: I gave Evans a try after my son's KTM 50cc (Senior and Mini) would always overheat. We tried multiple coolants. I flushed out the system and put the Evans in and it hasn't overheated since. It's incredible stuff!
customer_reviews.author: Chris N

customer_reviews.title: Why would anyone use normal anti freeze?
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely stopped overheating. No more worries in traffic, no more worries about corrosion. Excellent product , a bit expensive, and you do have to flush out all water. Easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not sure what to say. It seems to work ...
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what to say. It seems to work so far but the reason I bought it was so I never have to worry about it. Check back with me in ten years. :)
customer_reviews.author: J. Burgess

customer_reviews.title: If good enough for Jey Leno it's good enough for me.
customer_reviews.text: I used it in my 1926 Chevrolet. I've noticed a big difference. I can remove the radiator cap when the engine is hot, there's no pressure buildup. It does everything the description says to and more.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Palombo

customer_reviews.title: Best product for coolant in your cars or trucks
customer_reviews.text: Waterless coolant that you never have to replace. It's expensive but better for your vehicles especially if you keep your vehicles till the wheels fall off.
customer_reviews.author: Bullock

customer_reviews.title: Give me a better discount!!!
customer_reviews.text: The product is a good product but Amazon is a little pricey.I would think that they would have a better price being as big as they are as a retailer.
customer_reviews.author: Bigbones1

customer_reviews.title: Just had this installed in my Cadillac Northstar engine. ...
customer_reviews.text: Just had this installed in my Cadillac Northstar engine. Potential issues with a Northstar are/could be related to aluminum corrosion. I am hoping that this will reduce my risk of that potential catastrophic corrosion. I use this coolant in my four water cooled Honda motorcycles. In a motorcycle it is a no brainer because they use such a small amount of coolant. The cadillac Northstar used more than two gallons but an ounce of prevention is worth a pound of corroded aluminum engine heads.
customer_reviews.author: Fanazon

customer_reviews.title: Finally got a handle on it
customer_reviews.text: When I first converted to the "waterless" I felt that the temps were running a bit high, discovered that my system wasn't full and that my upper radiator hose was collapsed also! DUH! Bought the 4 gallons to have for another car but used a little to top off when I swapped out the upper hose, now my Seven doesn't run any hotter than 90 C on the highway or sitting in the Dream Cruise crawl.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: It worked great. lowered my cooling temp by 20 %
customer_reviews.text: It worked great . lowered my cooling temp by 20 %. no water no rust. great product.
customer_reviews.author: mark school

customer_reviews.title: So far very happy with this
customer_reviews.text: So far very happy with this, No signs of overheating or high pressures in the system. Will keep on monitoring and provide more feedback as time passes.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Best product ever
customer_reviews.text: Always happy with this coolant and I recommend more people try it Awesome
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: NEVER WORRY ABOUT OVER HEATING AGAIN
customer_reviews.text: GREAT PRODUCT used in 1992 buick roadmaster estate wagon (palm springs 115 degrees) house shopping, stop and go low speeds never went over 120 degrees all day (then palm springs to las vegas 115 degrees very high speed sometimes 85 plus on grades never went over 130 degrees totally sold on product a little pricey but worth it for the peace of mind in older cars. no hose failure,air conditioning much cooler! am going to put in our 1990 buick electra park avenue, and never have to worry about over heating or hose problems think we will break down and put in new buick verano,then good for life. totally sold!
customer_reviews.author: Manuel Martinez/Russell Smith

customer_reviews.title: Would have been nice if it came in a kit with the test ...
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as I ordered it. Would have been nice if it came in a kit with the test strips. Coolant, Prep, and test strips all together.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Jasinski

customer_reviews.title: Really easy to use and the truck runs a good 10 ...
customer_reviews.text: Really easy to use and the truck runs a good 10 degrees cooler with the waterless coolant! I just wish they had put the sticks to measure the water Content in with the kit. Too bad you have to buy them seperate.
customer_reviews.author: Ralf Hiller

customer_reviews.title: Everything is fine so far
customer_reviews.text: Everything is fine so far. The temperature is normal. I'll come back and give it a 5 start in about 9 months if I don't have to replace a radiator due to electrolysis. It needs to be in stores so you can purchase it. If you need any you have to order it and wait.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Evans coolant works! It is environmentally safe, NON-Toxic, saves your engine and prevents hose damage. Saves money and time.
customer_reviews.text: This product is the best after market product I have ever used. I have used this product on my Ford's over the years with zero problems. I never change my coolant now and the hoses last the life of the car. I have used this product for over ten years, in the same Ford Explorer V8 without any change to hoses or coolant. I save hundreds of dollars and the engine is like new, over 130,000 miles on the coolant. You will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Howard

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Just make sure you order more than you need. In case you can’t find locally like me.
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell hall

customer_reviews.title: It does as it claims
customer_reviews.text: Does what it claims. I used this in an old pickup with a heater core leak. I put some stop leak in then the Evens. The truck was just a spare vehicle until 6 months ago when it was pressed into daily service. Even with hot summer weather, now cold weather there’s been no leak. No pressure built up means the stop leak doesn’t blow out. I’m going to replace the coolant in all my vehicles. Why won’t everyone use this?
customer_reviews.author: N. Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Perfect replacement for antifreeze
customer_reviews.text: Evan's works great. Use it in a dirt race car.
customer_reviews.author: ron dunlap

customer_reviews.title: i received product after 4 days. the containers were ...
customer_reviews.text: i received product after 4 days.the containers were shipped laying on their side and leaked.no instructions were included nor did i receive any funnel or sticker for radiator cap.not what i expected for 185.00
customer_reviews.author: charles v.

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful so far
customer_reviews.text: Just made the switch. No problems so far. A bit messy to clean up spills but does not stain driveway.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Rosselle

customer_reviews.title: Solved my problem
customer_reviews.text: The Evans Prep and Evans NPG+ Coolant help me solve a significant over heating issue with a 2008 KTM EXC-R.
customer_reviews.author: yattr

customer_reviews.title: Save your engine!!
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommend using this coolant vs standard coolant especially in cars with plastic parts like BMW

customer_reviews.title: Problem Solver!
customer_reviews.text: Evans + tech advice solved a cooling problem on my antique MG. Will now use nothing else!

customer_reviews.title: Evans waterless coolant.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Delivered on time without delay. I am using this product in an auto restoration and I am very satisfied with its uses. I recommend it to others.
customer_reviews.author: Healey Man

customer_reviews.title: "Set it and forget it"
customer_reviews.text: Works, as long as you have patience. Let it soak for days or weeks. Youtube "electrolysis to remove rust" for faster results.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Marcero

customer_reviews.title: Higher temperatures with Evans
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this and the prep fluid, and I flushed my system twice. My operating temperatures were 80 to 90 degrees hotter than with regular coolant. Not impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Wretberg

customer_reviews.title: Best coolant/antifreeze EVER!!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing stuff. Every car should have this stuff in. I wish i knew about this product long ago. Don't worry about the price it pays for itself.
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: worth replacing the old stuff.
customer_reviews.text: always heard about a better coolant. especially for hot running cars like bmw. this coolant works very well; should have changed it sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Lei R Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but works well.
customer_reviews.text: I've used this product in my Dodge diesel truck for about 6 years now. Because it has such a high boiling point, the cooling system can use a low pressure cap, and the cooling system is less prone to failures. Because it is propylene glycol, it is much less dangerous to animals than regular anti-freeze. Never needs changing, so over a number of years its cost is probably equal to, or less than regular anti-freeze.
customer_reviews.author: John A. Hofstetter

customer_reviews.title: If it's good enough for Jay Leno It's good enough for me
customer_reviews.text: If you have a classic or antique car you need Evans! If it's good enough for Jay Leno It's good enough for me. I use it in my 90 year old car and I don't need to worry about electrolysis. Evens has a great technical support line. They are very responsive.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Palombo

customer_reviews.title: waterless coolant!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is great. It works well, and handles heat better. I have been using it for a year or so in my Jeep and am happy with the results.
customer_reviews.author: z

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I'm using in a old flathead ford, they tend to run hot, the coolant seems to work well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This stuff works and I'm a repeat buyer. The ...
customer_reviews.text: This stuff works and I'm a repeat buyer. The coolant must be used correctly and it requires work, but the results are rewarding. No steam, no corrosion, no system pressure and no boil overs or over heating. Operates at atmospheric pressure. Hoses and seals last far longer. System runs cooler and more efficiently. This is my personal belief.
customer_reviews.author: wayne l. cunningham

customer_reviews.title: Engine savior!
customer_reviews.text: No more cooling system pressure! I replaced my coolant with Evans waterless after a while my aux fan died and in heavy traffic my car went from 1/2 temp to red , I drove to a safe spot and stopped, took the rad cap out ...no pressure! If you don't know the pressure is the one killing head gaskets and ultimately engines with this ... you have no such worries.
customer_reviews.author: bd

customer_reviews.title: Evans Prep and Coolant
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Will use nothing else...ever. This is environmentally safe and protects engne at higher and lower temps. Same is true for the Prep.
customer_reviews.author: Wilbur Force

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 2000 BMW with over 200k miles and it's nice to not have to worry about coolant changes any longer. We also moved back to Houston from northern VA and the extreme heat and humidity associated with this area is no longer a concern. Excellent product by and large.
customer_reviews.author: txkawboi

customer_reviews.title: Evans coolant
customer_reviews.text: So far no problems at all No diff btwenn evans and regular coolant Seems to perform exactly as expected No overhea ting

customer_reviews.title: Great Stuff
customer_reviews.text: 20,000 miles on it now with dialy driver, track time and autoX on a turbo subaru with 542 hp. temperature never went up and never needed bigger radiator. I would completely recommend this stuff. Just wish it was a little cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: B. Jensen

customer_reviews.title: Quality product
customer_reviews.text: This is the only coolant that my son's truck will take so I kind of have to say it is a good product. Quite expensive but the coolant system in his diesel truck runs cool with this stuff in the system.
customer_reviews.author: tombstone

customer_reviews.title: Should be standard in all new vehicles
customer_reviews.text: The product improves the longevity of radiator,hoses and prevents corrosion of internal engine parts.Most people forget about their coolant. With this products you can!

customer_reviews.text: Great product, replaced antifreeze in my BMW Z3 with this which is stored 6 months of the year. Just make sure there are no leaks in the cooling system.

customer_reviews.title: Once the cooling system is properly converted (with Evans flush and removing as much water as possible) it is amazing and runs a
customer_reviews.text: Been using this coolant in my Civic for 2+ years. Once the cooling system is properly converted (with Evans flush and removing as much water as possible) it is amazing and runs at incredibly low pressure. So much less stress on the entire system.

customer_reviews.text: Way better than water for performance cars. Prevents localized (spot) flash steam that you get from water at high boost/power.

customer_reviews.text: Works well in my Jeep. Been running it for a few years and no issues.

customer_reviews.text: kx 450 riding enduro and getting bogged down in swamp thick woods caused my bike to overheat and lose coolant Haven't had my bike in quite the same conditions yet but it's been close I would buy again update ... still have not had any problems and I ran through the same area

customer_reviews.title: The product seems to work very well. I only ...
customer_reviews.text: The product seems to work very well. I only just started using it so time will tell, but it is true it does not create pressure in the system.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Stansel

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is fantastic. So glad I made the switch.
customer_reviews.author: John P Phillips

customer_reviews.title: coolent
customer_reviews.text: I was worried about this type of coolant letting the engine run too hot. Which some evans coolants can do. They won't boil over but still let the engine run when it should be stopped . The NPG+ Coolant diesel Evans is suppose to give greater cooling as well as not boil over. Which should work even better in my off road KTM fourstroke. They tend to run hot I would recommend temp sensor decales to make sure that that is in fact what is happening.
customer_reviews.author: david clifton

customer_reviews.title: Runs Hotter
customer_reviews.text: Like many others that bought this product; I also jump on it thinking that my engine would run better. What the manufacturer will not tell you is that your engine will run hotter. Engines are programed to run with water and glycol. If you are to change the coolant with this one then you will need to change the timing and the computer parameters. I flushed my entire coolant system, fallow all the instructions for the conversion to the waterless coolant and the engine was running hotter than usual. I had to flush the system again and put regular coolant back on it and it stop running hot.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: easy buy!!
customer_reviews.text: best stuff for muscle cars!!! keeps system from any corrosion especially with aluminum rad&heads cools great!!with hot cams and high stall conv.
customer_reviews.author: 468gto

customer_reviews.title: Best coolant in the world.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this in my drag car for almost 20 years. It keeps the engine much cooler than conventional coolants and I am sure it has saved my engine on more than one occasion.
customer_reviews.author: Steve W.

customer_reviews.title: Great Stuff
customer_reviews.text: If Jay Leno uses it in his cars, that's all I need to know. Avoid overheating and pressurization. Works great for my application.
customer_reviews.author: christopher

customer_reviews.title: from what I have read this stuff is great.. I hope so
customer_reviews.text: I have not put the car on the road yet , from what I have read this stuff is great .. I hope so , before I took the car off the road it had a problem of over heating... can't wait to test it out !!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Trusting in the product
customer_reviews.text: So far so good in this extreme cold weather. When it gets really warm I will see how thinks work. So far so good, come back in July
customer_reviews.author: Donald L Avery

customer_reviews.title: Worked as expected
customer_reviews.text: I put NPG in our 3 dirt bikes because we've had boil over issues while riding in Colorado at high altitudes (water boils at lower temperatures at higher altitudes). Initially we lost a small amount of fluid in each bike due to expansion which was expected based on what I had read. We never had a cooling related issue even though we rode more than 100 miles of mountain trails.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Huckstep

customer_reviews.title: Evans Coolant
customer_reviews.text: Product performs exactly as described in ads. Replaced year-old coolant in my K1200LT, BMW with Evans coolant. The bike not only runs cooler than average running down the road, but does not turn-on cooling fans at stop lights on 95plus degree days as it did before. Very impressive. I am switching my other bikes and cars to Evans.
customer_reviews.author: mjh

customer_reviews.title: evans rocks
customer_reviews.text: I replaced the coolant in my 08 super suty ford 6.4 diesel after I replaced the third radiator. The factory cooland, just like all the reat will build way too mutxh preasure and get way too hot causing excess preasure and over heating. The evans stops the cavitation and the heat issues preventing another radiator to pop. It works and its well worth the price even at $35 a gallon. If it keeps the radiator from getting a leak its great prevenative maint. Go get ya some, and maybe evans will sponsor me after this, but I know im not jay leno either.
customer_reviews.author: bjw

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: a GREAT upgrade. Just youtube the Jay LEno video on it to see the perks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: EVANS Cooling Systems EC53001 High Performance Waterless Engine Coolant, 128 fl. oz.
product_meta.description: Size:Pack of 1Evans High Performance Waterless Engine Coolant, EC53001, is specifically designed for all modern, classic, and vintage gasoline engines, light duty diesels, LP and CNG vehicles. Evans High Performance Coolant (HPC) defends against boil-over and corrosion while allowing the engine to continue producing its peak horsepower. When converting an engine from a water-based coolant to HPC, great care should be given during the installation (conversion) process to ensure that all of the old water-based coolant and water is removed before installing HPC. It is recommended that the system be flushed with Evans Prep Fluid prior to installing HPC When the installation is complete, the water content of the coolant should be no more than 3 percent for optimum performance. Evans HPC coolant contains a bittering agent/bitterant. Evans coolant is proudly made in the USA.
feature_bullets: Specifically designed for all modern, classic, and vintage gasoline-powered vehicles, light duty Diesels, LP and CNG vehicles
Has a boiling point of 375 DegreeF and will not vaporize, eliminating boilover and after-boil Generates low vapor pressures, prevents coolant loss, and reduces strain on cooling system components
Contains no water, effectively eliminating corrosion, liner and water pump cavitation erosion Minimizes the potential for corrosion and electrolysis issues, and reduces maintenance costs
Eliminates pre-ignition and engine knock caused by overheating, improving combustion efficiency to deliver more power and improved fuel economy
During installation ensure that all of old water-based coolant and water is removed before installing this product
